ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed better formal Chinese writing skills and learned how to better and more effectively communicate in formal Chinese language on topics such as foreign affairs, environmental science, and social issues.
Formal writing skills, news reading skills, oral skills
I gain critical Chinese writing skills in this course.
News language and oral presentation practice
I developed my ability to speak in Chinese about common news topics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is excellent. I loved the discussion of the additional articles, the presentations, and the daily news.
The course has very detailed and organized daily syllabus that was very clear to follow.
Professor cold calls students so must be prepared for class. Cons were that there was a lot of homework.

The course was overall great. Zhou Laoshi is a very kind instructor, the classroom setting was productive but not stressful, the vocabulary and content we learned was relevant, the assignments and grading was very fair. If I had to identify a place for improvement, it might be to cut down on the number of articles assigned each class day to read in advance, so students can focus on a few and discuss those in-depth during class. I also loved it when we watched the Chinese film Wedding Banquet in class and discussed it, and wished we could have done similar activities with movie watching and discussion in Chinese.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. At such a highly advanced level, this course truly facilitates utilizing the language in a dynamic way. Learning about current world affairs in Chinese is highly engaging, and Zhou LaoShi works hard to bring in additional topics that are equally interesting and relevant.
I would definitely recommend this course to students who are trying to improve their Chinese vocabulary and writing skills.
Yes if you want to elevate your Chinese.
Yes. Its important to be literate when it comes to news Chinese
Yes, I highly recommend this class to any student with advanced Chinese language skills. One can get a lot out of this course if they are willing to put in the work.
